result.execSummary:
The defendant Austin Edward Schmit was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Austin Edward Schmit is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Austin Edward Schmit was found guilty of Battery - Domestic Abuse Repeater [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Repeater, Domestic Abuse Assessments], an unclassified felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Austin Edward Schmit was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct - Domestic Abuse Repeater [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Repeater, Domestic Abuse Assessments], an unclassified felony, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Copy of minutes from PLEAS Hrg on 7/5/22 sent electronically to DCJ.

*** IN CUSTODY ***

03:15 PM Defendant in court with Attorney Adam Matthias Welch.  Carl Jacob Lazarus appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Plea Questionnaire & Waiver of Rights Signed. Def entered a plea of guilty to count 3 and 5.  Court accepted defendant's plea, found and adjudged defendant guilty. 

On Motion of the State, the Court DISM Count #1, 2, 4 and 6. 

Victim Rights Compliance

COUNT #3 and 5   
Court withholds sentence and places the Defendant on Probation for 2 years, each count cc to eachother and cc to 21CF1716 and cs to 20CF3080 

CONDITIONS:
-Serve 12 months in the Dane County Jail, w/huber, to commence f/w. Defendant shall serve 6 months and then remaining 6 months shall be imposed and stayed. cs to 20CF3080
-Maintain full-time employment/education or a combination of both for any week no reaching 40 hours will need to do community service for the remaining hours.
-Not use/possess drug paraphernalia and/or controlled substances without valid prescription
-No contact with: ODP without written consent from agent
-Not use/possess alcohol - Absolute Sobriet. 
- No bars, taverns or liquor stores or any other business whose primary business is the sale of alcohol 
-DOC DV treatment
-Defendant shall complete a risk and needs assessment and comply with care plan goals 
-DNA on file
-Any other conditions DOC may impose

COURT COSTS:
Ct #3 and 5
-DA surcharge
-All CC and DNA surcharge waived. V/W surcharge and DA surcharge due w/in 60 days. Payment plan approved/due on probation

-Days credit for time already served:  zero days
-Days credit if revoked: zero days

DE advised of post-conviction rights

Copy of minutes from BBH Hrg on 6/7/22 and bond form sent electronically to DCJ.

Cash bond is set in the amount of $1,500 (per case). If the defendant posts cash bail, the defendant must report to and comply with Pretrial Services. The defendant shall report to Pretrial Services by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail. The following checked category(s) are also ordered: _X_ GPS, __ Remote Breath (Alcohol) Monitoring, and/or __ Random Drug Testing.
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with ODP. 
- Defendant shall not operate a motor vehicle. 
- Defendant shall not use/possess controlled substances or drug paraphernalia without a valid prescription. 
NONCOMPLIANCE WILL BE REPORTED BY DCPS TO THE JUDICIARY WHO SHALL RESPOND IN ONE OF THESE WAYS: Schedule bail hearing, Increase Supervision, Issue warrant, No change but monitor.
Referral to Dane County Pretrial Services

10:21 AM Defendant in court, in custody with Attorney Adam Matthias Welch.  Daniel R. Hess appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State requests cts 1-6 be found transactionally related. No objection by DE. Court finds cts 1-6 transactionally related. Detective B. Ware duly sworn, direct and cross. Det. identified Defn in court. State moves for bind over, waives argument and reserves rebuttal. DE objects, waives argument. Court finds PC, case bound over for trial. On the motion to modify bail: Argument by atty Welch. State objects, gives argument. Court denies motion at this time, may be renewed upon outcome of pending revocation hearing in a differnt case. ARGN TO BE SET BY TRIAL BRANCH.
